content: I see it on the roadmap, and I see zulip/django-openid-auth.. is this something that still works?

Two factor auth, specifically to be able to use it with Google Auth is certainly something I would like. Obviously there is the requirement to then build that support into both the web, mobile and desktop clients or to be able to created dedicated app keys to login on devices that don't support 2 factor auth.
Yeah, so the story on 2FA is that the easiest mechanism is of course to just configure to only use an SSO mechanism that already has 2FA, but there's an open PR that adds 2FA on web.
And of course doesn't enforce 2FA for mobile login, since the mobile app doesn't support it yet.
Taking that this is #5753, reading it, it looks like its not too far away anyway.
